repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: floating window missing statusline

Solution: Add a 'statusline' field to the winconfig. When set to true
and `laststatus` is 1 or 2, the statusline will be rendered in floating windows.
Changes to `laststatus` in the command line will also affect the floating
window's statusline. eq `set laststatus = 0` for disable it, also call api
`:lua vim.api.nvim_win_set_config(0, { statusline = false })` will also
update the floating window's statusline.

![test4](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c4a6cc9-f530-4ac7-8061-6db6732ff702)



Fix #16753

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -147,6 +147,7 @@ API
   escape sequences to the terminal when Nvim is running in the |TUI|.
 • |nvim_echo()| can set the |ui-messages| kind with which to emit the message.
 • |nvim_echo()| can create |Progress| messages
+• |nvim_open_win()| now supports rendering the statusline.

comment_data.body:
the order of these fields is a mess but at least non-private fields should go before private fields (underscore)

same for the docs.

use `VALIDATE_` macro.
idk the rest of this function does not, but it should (not in this PR)

why is this an error though? a window might temporarily set height=0 and that could just silently not show the statusline?
`:help 'laststatus'` should be updated to mention floating windows
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3899,6 +3899,8 @@ nvim_open_win({buffer}, {enter}, {config})                   *nvim_open_win()*
                   • _cmdline_offset: (EXPERIMENTAL) When provided, anchor the
                     |cmdline-completion| popupmenu to this window, with an
                     offset in screen cell width.
+                  • statusline: If true, render statusline on floating window.
+                    Only takes effect when 'laststatus' is not 0.

comment_data.body:
assigning a boolean to an int?
```suggestion
  wp->w_status_height = (fconfig.statusline && p_ls != 0) ? 1 : 0;
```
why are both `wp->w_status_height` and `wp->w_config.statusline` needed? seems like they mean the same thing, approximately.

> use VALIDATE_ macro.

VALIDATE macro isn't quite appropriate here... these looks not clear as currently 

```C
if (HAS_KEY_X(config, statusline)) {
  VALIDATE(!(config->statusline && config->height == 1),
           "'height' must be greater than 1 when 'statusline' is set%s", "",
           goto fail);
  fconfig->statusline = config->statusline;
}
or 
  VALIDATE(!(config->statusline && config->height == 1),
           "'height' must be greater than 1 when 'statusline' is set%s", "",
           goto fail);
```

> why is this an error though? a window might temporarily set height=0 and that could just silently not show the statusline?

Currently it behaves the same way as the winbar and counts toward `fconfig.height`.If `fconfig.height` is 4 and statusline is enabled, the usable height becomes 3 because one row is taken by the statusline. 
1.  ~~if fconfig.height is 1, only the statusline would be shown. So the height is 1, the statusline should not be displayed. this should be mentioned in the doc.~~
2. does not count toward `fconfig.height`, the height is not reduced by the floating statusline height in `win_set_inner_size`,  then when the height is 1 it becomes irrelevant. 

I’ve updated the PR with 2 for now.
I have updated field and doc order

comment_regular_data.body:
> When set to true and laststatus is not 0, the statusline will be rendered in floating windows

wouldn't it make sense to *not* render the statusline in floating windows when `laststatus == 3` (global statusline)?

That was also how I implemented it at the beginning, it only rendered when laststatus was 2. But floating windows aren’t organized in the  tree structure as normal windows, so they behave differently. Maybe rendering it when laststatus is 3 could also make sense for some users?

> That was also how I implemented it at the beginning, it only rendered when laststatus was 2. But floating windows aren’t organized in the tree structure as normal windows, so they behave differently. Maybe rendering it when laststatus is 3 could also make sense for some users?

Does this PR change the behavior of `laststatus=3` so the global statusline on the bottom only reflects windows in the tree structure? (as opposed to how it does currently, where it always reflects the active window, even if it's floating) If so, that's great, but if not, wouldn't that just make the same statusline appear twice?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(float): supports render statusline
